nodes.bodyText: Are you sure you did not replace the correct format with the wrong one?

@dkayiwa
PersonService#getSimilarPeople(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) - does not exist in the PersonService class, that's why I corrected to PersonService#getSimilarPeople(java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String)
Proof: https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-core/blob/master/api/src/main/java/org/openmrs/api/PersonService.java#L97
PersonDAO#getSimilarPeople(String name, Integer birthyear, String gender) - it is not removed, only the word "gender" has been moved to the line above. This is by java convention and improves readability.
Proof: https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-core/pull/3525/files#diff-8418a7dc796909a947781080e9b24f83R181
Does javadoc require java.lang.String or String name?

@dkayiwa There are two adjacent lines, two links, the first is java.lang.String, the second is String name. You can leave it, but does it not disturb the readability? Wouldn't it be better to replace it with 2xjava.lang.String or 2xString name?

https://www.oracle.com/technical-resources/articles/java/javadoc-tool.html#multiple@see
Oracle documentation accepts both forms, it is up to you to choose which form to use. ;)
